name: job-execution-correlation
description: Automatic correlation chain from scheduled job execution to messages published by job handlers via AsyncLocal ambient context

userStories.title: Create MessagingCorrelationScope
userStories.notes: MessagingCorrelationScope created in Headless.Messaging.Abstractions. AsyncLocal-based, sealed, IDisposable, nesting-safe. Begin() factory, IncrementSequence() with Interlocked.
userStories.description: AsyncLocal-based ambient correlation context in Headless.Messaging.Abstractions. Sealed class with static Current, Begin() factory, IDisposable, CorrelationId (string), _sequence (int field for Interlocked.Increment), nesting-safe via parent restore. Chosen over MassTransit's scoped DI approach because publishers aren't resolved from dispatcher scope. Chosen over Ticker's ParentId entity model because we need correlation propagation, not execution trees.
acceptanceCriteria: MessagingCorrelationScope sealed class in Headless.Messaging namespace (Abstractions)
AsyncLocal<MessagingCorrelationScope?> for ambient context with static Current property
Begin() factory, IDisposable for cleanup, nesting-safe via parent scope restore
CorrelationId (string) and _sequence (private int field) with Interlocked.Increment
XML docs

userStories.title: Populate correlation in ScheduledJobDispatcher
userStories.notes: CorrelationId set to execution.Id.ToString(), headers populated with corr-id and corr-seq=0, MessagingCorrelationScope.Begin() wraps handler invocation via using var.
userStories.description: Set CorrelationId = execution.Id (was null), populate headers with correlation metadata, wrap handler invocation in MessagingCorrelationScope.Begin(). Scope disposed in finally.
acceptanceCriteria: CorrelationId = execution.Id.ToString() instead of null
Headers populated: headless-corr-id = execution ID, headless-corr-seq = 0
using MessagingCorrelationScope.Begin() wrapping handler invocation
Scope disposed in finally block even on handler failure

userStories.title: Make publishers read MessagingCorrelationScope
userStories.notes: Both OutboxPublisher and DirectPublisher now check MessagingCorrelationScope.Current. If scope active: use scope.CorrelationId + IncrementSequence(). If no scope: existing behavior (MessageId, seq=0). Explicit headers always win.
userStories.description: OutboxPublisher and DirectPublisher auto-inherit correlation from ambient MessagingCorrelationScope when CorrelationId not in explicit headers. Explicit headers always win. Backward compatible.
acceptanceCriteria: Both publishers check MessagingCorrelationScope.Current when CorrelationId not in headers
If scope exists: use scope.CorrelationId, CorrelationSequence = scope.IncrementSequence()
If scope null: existing behavior (CorrelationId = MessageId, sequence = 0)
Explicit headers always override ambient scope
No behavior change when no scope active (backward compatible)

userStories.title: Unit tests for correlation propagation
userStories.notes: Tests added: MessagingCorrelationScopeTests (scope lifecycle, nesting, sequence), ScheduledJobDispatcherTests (correlation context, scope during/after dispatch), DirectPublisherTests (scope inheritance, explicit header override, backward compat). Fixed existing BeNull assertion.
userStories.description: Tests for MessagingCorrelationScope lifecycle, ScheduledJobDispatcher correlation setting, OutboxPublisher/DirectPublisher ambient inheritance, explicit header override, backward compatibility.
acceptanceCriteria: MessagingCorrelationScope: begin/dispose, nesting, thread-safe sequence
ScheduledJobDispatcher: sets CorrelationId, populates headers, begins scope
Publishers: inherit correlation from scope, explicit headers override, no scope = existing behavior
TestBase, AbortToken, should_*_when_* naming
